website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for smaller workspaces, this scroll saw cuts accurately with a bit of practice.
pros: Experienced users have little problem making straight, precise cuts
Compact and relatively easy to move around if needed
cons: Has trouble with thicker wood pieces over one inch
Vibrates too much for some users
Some feel that it’s too flimsy for regular use

customer_reviews.title: Do not like it
customer_reviews.text: I do not like it. It is very cheap made i regret buying it. I got it to cut flooring I am installing. It is very slow to cut and just does not work very well for this at all. I did get all the flooring in but using this was not fun. On the longer cuts it takes a long time and is hard to keep an even cut going that long for 3 to 4 foot long cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for where space is at a premium.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have the luxury of keeping lots of power tools out for ready use. Like most people my only space is my garage which is limited. This table saw I can put on a shelf and bring down to use quickly on my folding B&D WorkMate folding workbench. The light weigh makes it very portable. The many included blades give it versatility. The vacuum attachment means cutting is a clean activity. I need to make cuts regularly and the BladeRunner does the job while nicely fitting into my life.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Good

customer_reviews.title: Excited to get this saw. I soon found it ...
customer_reviews.text: Excited to get this saw. I soon found it would not cut straight. I then bought the sled which I thought would solve the problem. It did not. I was sure it was something I was doing wrong, so I kept trying. I started reading reviews here and other posts on the internet. I contacted Rockwell. They agreed to replace the saw, but I had to pay shipping, which was in my opinion exorbitant. I will not donate this or try to resell. The only place for it is in a land fill.
customer_reviews.author: kab

customer_reviews.title: The Best Table Saw for straight and Diagonal Cuts
customer_reviews.text: I used this to install laminate wood flooring myself. This product was everything I needed and more. There are several blades for optional pieces. If you're doing more than one room, just buy extra blades to replace once your blade is dull. I also loved the versatility of the machine. The blade can be pressed down and turned in different directions to achieve angles and diagonal cuts. Additonally, you hook your vacuum to the hose on the saw and it sucks up the saw dust as you're cutting You will be definitely satisfied with this saw. Recommendation: Please have extra blades because your blade will get dull. Orhan than that. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: M.  Sample

customer_reviews.title: Blade runner X2
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why people are saying this cannot cut hardwood . Done contours through three eights inch black walnut. Made straight cuts through 1 in.2 Cocobolo, zebrawood and Nicaraguan Rosewood, Using the wood knife blade that came with the machine. It is not a scroll saw for hardwood but it will cut straight through without any problem . With a 3 year warranty, It's a keeper for me .
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome machine. Make no mistake
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome machine. Make no mistake, this is basically a sabre saw mounted upside-down in a table-top enclosure, but that is the beauty of it. I love this thing. As other reviewers have mentioned, the vibration is considerable and it really needs to be held down. The little edge-clamp at the front will stop it from moving backwards from the edge of whatever table or work surface you put it on. Combine that with some hand pressure as you work the piece through the saw and it will remain fairly well under control. However I have had occasions where I've clamped the whole thing down to the table with bar clamps.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher L. Barber

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed :-(
customer_reviews.text: I've used it 3 times, for very small projects, and I've already went through 4 blades. It is very cheaply built. The video shows I man cutting a 2 x 4, but I seriously have my doubts that is possible. I would not recommend this for any one doing a flooring job or heavy duty project.
customer_reviews.author: Cecelia A. Benefield

customer_reviews.title: worked well until it failed
customer_reviews.text: saved much hand sawing effort - made many pieces. Until I tried trimming tiny ends off small stock wood pieces - the cut-off ends fell down into the throat and got caught in the mechanism and completely jammed the up-down moving parts. Tried to fish them out, but too tightly imbedded and attempts to disassemble resulted in a complete dismantling which could not be put back together. Discarded the entire unit and replaced it with a tabletop scroll saw. Had I used a strong vacuum at the blade, or a dedicated blow tube (as the scroll saw has), perhaps this problem could have been avoided. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: William H. Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: Interesting little saw
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a number of times since getting it, and I am happy with it. I've done rip cuts, cross cuts, and some free form cutting on both pine and various hardwoods. After reading the reviews, I threw out the blades that came with it, and bought the Bosch blades recommended. The cuts I've done were easy and clean. Straight cuts are great, no problems at all. Free form cutting is not quite as easy - for smaller pieces you really have to keep a good grip on the wood or it will tend to jump around. The safety features are very nice, and I'm comfortable with my son using this with my help.
customer_reviews.author: J. Russo

customer_reviews.title: Good for a light DIY user
customer_reviews.text: This is not a professional tool by any stretch but I didn't pay professional prices either. That said, the Rockwell heritage is clear from the fact that it works just as promised. I didn't rate versatility because all I've done so far is rip and crosscut and it does both more than adequately. Given that I was working with bamboo flooring and there was no shredding or loose fibers, I was impressed. Some vibration but that seemed to be a result of me being in a hurry and pushing the stock too hard. For the same needs I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Conant

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with the product
customer_reviews.text: The blade runner performs per the manufacturers claims, we were easily able to cut through a 2x4 with multiple cuts. In addition, we used it on cement board using a tile blade and it was able to cut through it as well. Though I would suggest not to use it for cutting 5 ft boards, the blade will overheat and bend but for small cuts it should work well. We have not tried the miter nor tile cutting functions, but it looks promising. I would recommend this to anyone, as long as they keep in mind this is for smaller jobs.
customer_reviews.author: KrystalTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Does not cut straight and difficult to use with long pieces.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this product as a safe alternative to a table saw as I got into woodworking. With the use of a jigsaw blade over a circular blade, it definitely is safer, but that's all that I can say that is good. The blades do not cut straight. The mounting mechanism is at a constant angle, so cutting straight pieces is nearly impossible. Additionally, the metal that holds the arm is thicker than the blade which causes it to be hard to push pieces through when you are using the width guide. It might work fine with some very thin material, but not a replacement for a table saw.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Gladson

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for about a year and have tried to use it several times with the sames result. Your simply cannot rip anything from 1/4 inch plywood to 1/2 soft pine with decent results. I can do better with my jig saw and a straight edge. The are is too flimsy to hold the blade in place. It wanders left and right and no matter how you position the side rail when your work piece gets to the back it never lines up with the splitter at the back. It may work with balsa wood or real thin wood for a modler but not for a home do it yourselfer
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: Meets the basic need
customer_reviews.text: Got a used or returned product. See images. Most of metal parts were rusted which makes me wonder about the durability of the product. My project was a small one that I for sure know that this could be used.
customer_reviews.author: R user

customer_reviews.title: This thing is worthless, save your money and go buy/rent a table saw.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is complete junk. I bought it to make long cuts in vinyl flooring planks. If you want to make long straight cuts, go buy a proper table saw. The arm on this thing is too flimsy and the upright holding the arm stops the cut once the board hits it. You'll make straighter cuts with a jig saw or other hand held saw. It looks like it's too late for me to return this, so it's probably going in the trash. I'm really surprised by this one. We own a Rockwell handheld Sonicrafter saw that is amazing. I expected better from them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for home projects
customer_reviews.text: I used this saw along with the additionally purchased cross cut slider to put in a pergo floor. It went fast. As others have suggested, the first thing to do, buy new blades. Blades matter. I didn't use the blades that came with the saw because all the reviews I read and videos I watched said to use a quality blade. It is light weight, and it can bounce around, so make sure you anchor it down. But, I had no problems with rip cuts or cross cuts. If you are a contractor, don't expect a $1000 saw. But for people like me who occasionally need to cut something or do small projects, this puppy rocks!
customer_reviews.author: J. Rambo

customer_reviews.title: FLIMSY --- WIGGLY --- SLOPPY
customer_reviews.text: THIS SAW is light weight, easy to assemble, and blade change is simple. That's the good. The bad is that the miter gauge (crosscut guide) is sloppy. There is no way to get an even remotely accurate cut. I'm not talking about small errors here of a degree or two. I'm talking about gross inaccuracy resulting from extreme slop. The miter slot in the plastic table is way too wide for the rail of the guide. Also, there is considerable flex. The rip fence appears to be much more stable. If all you ever want to do is freehand cutting and possibly ripping, this may be your saw. Otherwise, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Silicon Valley Dave

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this saw
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this saw! I've been using it to cut aluminum, up to 3/4-inch solid stock, and it has performed flawlessly. A few pointers: Use the proper blade for the material, use cutting oil for metals, go slow, especially witu metals, and learn to adjust the saw properly. Make sure you get the guard arm locked down so there's no movement of the arm. Also, be sure to set the guard down tightly on the material to be cut. These two things will keep the material from wandering and the blade straight. Absolutely recommend the Bladerunner X2!
customer_reviews.author: T.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Portability for Light Sawing Needs
customer_reviews.text: Great portable saw for light duty work. I bought it to do band saw type work and the precision is not there. The blade has too much play to demand accuracy in tight quarters. If you want a small saw to do light work, this is a great saw. If you are buying it to stand in as a jig saw or band saw, you will need to spend more money. I returned mine.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Felcher

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and handy for making small cuts. Buy new, good quality blades for best performance.
customer_reviews.text: Think of this as an upside down jigsaw under a table. The supplied blades are trash, throw them away. With a high quality blade, it cuts very well. It’s also very light. I keep it handy near whatever job I’m doing to make small cuts, nips here or there, etc. I would not use it for precision cuts or ripping, etc. Think of it as being handier and easier (faster maybe) than a small hand saw for doing small, light cuts. I wouldn’t bother buying the cutting sled as it’s lightweight, thin plastic and you don’t really need it for the role this tool plays in a shop. I’m an advanced hobbiest woodworker.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Huntington

customer_reviews.title: Very very nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice, just as pictured and just as described, works as expected, it does a multitude of cutting operations, wood, steel, copper, pvc, ceramic, tile, rip cuts with the included rip fence, mitre cuts with the included mitre gauge, quick blade changes, and it comes with 4 blades but I suggest you buy more that suit you needs, only 15 pounds, built in carrying handle, east to Store or hang on the wall, I highly recommend for any crafts person but it's perfect for a person with long minted space like me, I own a town house with no shed or basement
customer_reviews.author: Endevour32

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: So far I have been satisfied with this little saw. I am only using it with small items from m wood to copper and pvc but it has performed well. I am using the cross cut sled but it is not accurate. I have not tried the blades provided but have used Bosch clean cut blades and I have gotten really clean cuts that would be good enough for making segmented wood projects. At this price point this machine performs admirably. With that being said I would love to find a more professional version if one was made. If I could go back in time I would gladly purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Silenthunder

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw
customer_reviews.text: I’m a pretty avid woodworker, wanted something small for my shop to make quick cuts on. This thing is great, very impressed with the capabilities of this little saw, can almost replace a band saw and table saw, I’ve ripped 4x8 sheet of wood on this. The only con is the small work space and limited range of the fence. If they made a model with an extending work surface and fence it would be great, or even an accessory you could buy later
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's a unique and somewhat useful product, but you'll be better off spending a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an upside down jig saw. This comes with all the difficulties of using an upside down jigsaw, minus holding a jigsaw upside down. High vibration, trouble keeping the piece you're cutting from jumping up and down with the blade (and the clamp doesn't really cut it). That said, it's a unique and somewhat useful product, but you'll be better off spending a little more for a bandsaw. Indeed, the bandaw is basically the solution to the up motion of a up-and-down blade.
customer_reviews.author: Reerr

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate or precise for any use (that I have found.)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a general hobby saw for various uses a year or so ago. Ultimately it has sat unused as the quality of cuts are extremely poor. Perhaps good for hack cuts (think what you can do with a jigsaw) but not for anything else. FORGET ABOUT ANY PRECISION WITH THIS. And I do not mean for small pieces... really for anything. Wish I had made another decision. Will likely give away to local good will shop.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C

customer_reviews.title: BAD Choice
customer_reviews.text: This thing does not work well at all. I have to exchange it early on because of a flaw. I used it to cut several strips of plywood and it struggled. The advertisement stated that or alluded to ease of use. That is so not true. I have tried to sell it but for now I am stuck with it. I have since purchased a RYOBI Table saw and it works like a charm along side the Miter Saw. I was not familiar with Rockwell and I should have kept it that way... Such a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, smal-project tool
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for small repairs and projects mostly done by my wife. During the summer months we can only work in our wood shop (in a not air-conditioned shed) a couple of hour in the early morning. We use the Blade Runner in the house. My wife's as handy with tools as I am, but doesn't like using the table saw for small item cuts. The Blade Runner is a good alternative, however it is pretty limited mostly because of it's small table size. I'm designing a modest drop-in MDF table to surround our Blade Runner. We've used the tool three or four times since acquiring it and are satisfied with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: All Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used today to rip long sections of corner molding and it was great. I wish i'd have had this when i started the project i bought it to finish. Saw is well thought out in design, going to be a very valuable addition and nicely compact so that it doesn't take up a lot of garage space.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Not even worth HALF the price
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not worth HALF the price it's sold for. 1, it's so light, it hardly stays in place 2, the fence guard is nearly impossible to measure perfectly for straight cuts, defeating the POINT of the thing 3, once you get to the shoulder of the cutting arm, it's so hard to push the material through, (it gets bound up between the shoulder and fence guard) 4, the blades that come with the device are made of cheap metal
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Can't handle laminate flooring workload
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for it's light weight and usefulness as a scroll/jig/rip saw. Same as other reviews, the blades can't handle the work, mainly because the flimsy plastic support arms vibrate too much. In fact, now the spring mechanism that unlocks the larger arm for blade removal no longer works so I will have to use pliers to dislodge it. I'm not happy with this at all. My jigsaw ended up doing most of the work.
customer_reviews.author: Mike De Luna

customer_reviews.title: Refurb review + new Review
customer_reviews.text: I bought a refurb on Amazon and ended up returning it. The issue was that parts were missing. Being somewhat desperate, I bought a new unit from Lowes (all parts included). I used it for a laminate flooring project and it did very well. As long as you are patient with your cuts, you can easily cut straight lines. I did end up also buying craftmans blades as I needed a variety for the project. Overall I'm glad I got this unit. Amazon did take care of me when I called about the refurb unit. No hassles.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Table Saw
customer_reviews.text: Just received this yesterday and I admit I was a little unsure of the quality of a portable table saw in this price range. I've been using it to trim off grout from a bunch of loose tile on my patio and it has been working flawlessly. Using diamond and ceramic t-shank blades it cuts through the old grout almost like butter, has yet to hang up or even slow down. I am extremely happy with this product and have many more projects lined up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Carson Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Had to send it back
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware! I didn’t believe the other reviews about the saw not being able to rip the length of a board. Surely other users had to be wrong. A company as reputable as Rockwell would account for this feature. Sure enough, the thickness of the piece at the back of the saw along with the poor tracking of the blade makes ripping boards impossible. The cut grove will not track past the stand when using the fence. I tried for a week to contact Rockwell and their number just automatically says everyone is busy and hangs up. This is one time you need to pay attention to the reviews, if you plan on ripping material choose a different item.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Worked ok for me
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It’s adequate for simple repairs around the house. But if your a wood guy (or gal) this probably isn’t going to be what you want. I was able to rip some 2x4 ‘s for my outdoor kitchen bar. It took a while, but did the job. It is also very portable. Overall I’m happy with it. I was able to complete my project without investing in a $300 saw that I likely wouldn’t get much use from afterwards. Definitely lighter duty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: . Unusual but very useful saw
customer_reviews.text: This is an unusual saw that I find to be very useful. It is basically an upside-down saber saw, with a blade guide above, and an adjustable guide to keep the piece being cut flat on the table. That's a job you would have to do with your fingers, at some risk, if it were not there. My only objection is that when making longer cuts, they must be very straight, because the cut kerf has to fit the slender blade at the back of the saw that supports the blade guide and work clamp.Otherwise, the saw binds and jams the piece being cut. For free-hand curves in larger pieces of material it is necessary to remove the entire superstructure.
customer_reviews.author: tkeithlu

customer_reviews.title: Plastic toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a tool. It is a plastic toy. It took me over two hours to rip a 12 foot 2x4 down the middle. The cut was not straight and it was excruciatingly slow and painful. The arm did not provide any value and I had to take it off. The vac hookup is a cheep piece of plastic and did not stay in place. If you are looking for a tool, this is not it. If you want a toy and don't mind getting frustrated - knock yourself out.
customer_reviews.author: mbeyder

customer_reviews.title: Ok for smaller projects
customer_reviews.text: Okay for small projects definitely not professional quality by far. You need some way of securing it to a table. It does have mounting holes just keep in mind you won't be able to just set on a table and rip wood. Overall it worked for my smaller projects but it left me wanting something more professional quality. It's not a table saw. It's not a chop saw. It's a jigsaw inverted. It doesn't rip wood very straight so if you need exact it shows. Probably ok short straight cuts but not the best for long straight or bulky sheets of plywood. It is a cheap diy kinda ok saw that does exactly that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: with plastic base makes for pretty awesome starter saw for my 7 & 11 year ...
customer_reviews.text: Interesting saw. Needs a few improvements... some have had a huge impact on this review. 1) underpowered! Badly! Needs ,at minimum , 7.0+ Amp motor. Struggles and bogs cutting through 1/2" hardwood (birch at that!!!) 2) plastic base means instability. However, this size, with plastic base makes for pretty awesome starter saw for my 7 & 11 year old and their crafting! It is now mounted on their workbench, and used!!! Not a worthless tool. Not a tool for professionals either.... if you were thinking "cheap scroll saw", just buy a scroll saw!!!
customer_reviews.author: Beau C.

customer_reviews.title: Not so good with thin aluminum
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed in this saw. I purchased to cut .032 Aluminum , something it definitely does not do. It will hack it's way through but forget using the fence , you can not keep it straight. And yes, the proper blades were used. Can't say about wood or plastic. Not at all what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Bayard T Keller

customer_reviews.title: This is a Kids Toy
customer_reviews.text: After doing 2 small 11x12 Bedrooms, and 1 side of a 15 foot Hallway I could NO Longer get this POS to cut a straight line even doing the 5" width of a Laminate fiberboard it had a drift of 1/2". I even used the Rockwell extended table. When attempting length cuts it would hangup on the support arm.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD H HANSEN JR

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Not the best saw table. It made my project a little harder than expected. Anything close to an inch thick will be cut but in a prolonged process. The blades move too much, and I didn't get a truly straight cut. The table saw itself is well built and sturdy. The more I used it, the more I figure it out and found a way to still make it useful. I would be buying a more expensive and popular brand instead in the future
customer_reviews.author: Wilmar

customer_reviews.title: I loved the idea of both hands free for holding the ...
customer_reviews.text: When I got my saw, I was too excited to take it out to garage/shop to set it up. I set it on my kitchen counter/bar and in minutes I was using it. I loved the idea of both hands free for holding the wood and a guide for precise cutting. I needed to shave 1/4 inch off three shelves from a closet. First time use and without a problem, I cut precisely what needed to be cut. I love it. Now on to some bigger projects. (after I finish cleaning all the sawdust out of my kitchen)
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda Bilya

customer_reviews.title: Does not cut clean
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. It’s essentially a jig saw but up side down. I saw a lot of good reviews for this product which was why I bought it. Unfortunately its terrible. If you need it to cut clean You’ll have to put a lot of pressure by where the blade is, and that is completely unsafe. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Eng Vang

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for 3 Saws
customer_reviews.text: With this saw I can cut all types of wood and vinyl flooring, I can cross cut, rip cut and cut circles or other irregular cuts. Works perfect and takes up less space than the 3 other saws.
customer_reviews.author: Allan J.

customer_reviews.title: Light and Quick
customer_reviews.text: I am please with the performance of this small tabletop saw. It's light weight, which makes for easy set-up and clean up. Dust collector port is handy. If you use a jig saw for projects, this will increase your cut accuracy and consistency. As recommended I purchased the bosch blade set, and I'm glad I did. The blades are sharper and cut cleaner. The blades that come with the saw are decent enough for most projects. I was working with 1/4 and 1/2 inch plywood and it tore out the top ply.
customer_reviews.author: s975

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: This portable little table top saw is pretty darn awesome for this weekender DYI-er. It was simple to put together out of the box and is easy to use. Came with a variety of blades for different project materials and is quick and easy to change the blades out. Has little guides for cutting straight up to 6 inches and cutting angles too! My only complaint is it is a bit on the loud side, even with ear protection, but it’s still an awesome tool.
customer_reviews.author: KcMey636

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as depicted.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this specifically to rip 8' 1x6 boards as shown in multiple sales videos and commercial. There is WAY to much vibration to be able to be practical for this . I even tried bolting it too the table and buying the best blades possible and I can still rip a board with a skill saw twice as fast and with a cleaner edge . Vibration is so bad that everything on the table ends up on the floor including the extra blades stored in the side compartment of the saw
customer_reviews.author: john koen

customer_reviews.title: Complete garbage DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This thing is completely useless. I've been in the woodworking trade for nearly 20 years and can honestly and confidently say this tool is engineered incorrectly. You cannot cut a straight line using the guides that are there to ensure a stright line, this product is defective. Returned after 10 minutes of use This product should be discontinued immediately.
customer_reviews.author: nunya beese

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: It arrived yesterday, I unboxed it then plugged it up to ensure it works. It runs. Went to use it today. 5 minutes, yes minutes!, Into the first cut, and I'm barely halfway through the board. my board is ruined because the blade bends and goes way off course, even with using the guard and the fence. It's so slow at cutting. I could have cut it faster and straighter with a handsaw. This saw has no power to cut through anything. Spend a bit more and get a real saw.
customer_reviews.author: jeremiah merchant

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile investment for light jobs or hobbies
customer_reviews.text: Happy for the help this jigsaw has provided in cutting baseboards. Had to purchase very large blades at local Lowes, but because it's a standard size, they fit well. I wish the guides included could work on both the right and left side. When doing cuts it can get awkward trying to wrestle the mitre guide from just the left. Also wish the guides were a bit longer to guide further, but I'm managing to get the job done faster than a traditional mitre box, so it's manageable. Looking forward to other projects utilizing this saw.
customer_reviews.author: CCCampbell

customer_reviews.title: Junk-save your money (twice bought, returned both)
customer_reviews.text: Neat design but I wouldn't buy this for my enemy. Poorly assembled, poor quality and poor quality checked. Allowances of assembly are way way too forgiving. Blade doesn't meet up with the safety guides in arm. Arm seems to be pressed into plastic bracket uneven on purpose during assembly. Blade does not make a clean cut at all. Customer service kind of sucks (I guess that's the norm nowadays). Sent for a replacement. Replacement has a broken plastic piece that couldn't have happened during shipping. I'm dusting my feet off and walking away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Manasseh

customer_reviews.title: This is built like a Mattel toy
customer_reviews.text: This is built like a Mattel toy. It is all plastic. The good news is that it works as good - maybe better - than a saber saw clamped upside down on a piece of plywood. The instructions rely on pictograms and you may not recognize that to secure the blade, one must press the red button and move it to the side. It has its uses, but I wouldn't rely on this to replace a bandsaw or table saw.
customer_reviews.author: Silverback

customer_reviews.title: Ooops, I thought I was buying a Scroll Saw. This is a Jigsaw.
customer_reviews.text: Ooops, I searched for a scroll saw, looked at a bunch, and decided on this one. I realized later that it's not a scroll saw, it's a jigsaw! Dang it, I should have looked at the type of blade it uses. This saw comes up in the search for scroll saws........ oh well, it'll be useful enough for some projects here and there, so I'll keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rockwell BladeRunner
customer_reviews.text: I have had this little machine since June, and I really am pleased with it. It works great on various types of wood. I am a DIY'er and love to make wood items. I do have a question. I think the red button that you push to install the blade is not working. I have tried several times to press the button to remove the blade, but it's not working for me. Is there something else I am supposed to do? I do need to change my blade, but can't get the old one out. Thanks for any suggestions.
customer_reviews.author: DIANE BONNER

customer_reviews.title: I like this little saw a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like this little saw a lot. I find myself using it frequently. It's not for heavy duty work, but it's powerful enough for small quick cuts on various items: wood (1" thick or less), plywood and plastic. The housing and decking is made of hard plastic, but the motor for cutting seems strong and able to do the job. The instructions for assembly and operation are not very clear and you need to look closely at them to see what they mean. The instructions are all pics with very little written detail.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry & Jane Malakosky

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not awesome
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for what I needed it for, which was cutting vinyl plank flooring. Some time later I tried cutting some peg board that was 4 foot in length. I had to remove all the safety components due to the throat being to thick. I couldn't cut more than 12" in length without removing that mechanism. For that reason and only that reason I knocked off a star. I will be using it again, and again, but I still need to buy a table saw for precise ripping of boards.
customer_reviews.author: Rolling 777

customer_reviews.title: blades do not change as easily as stated
customer_reviews.text: Please, don't be fooled buy the videos and high ratings. Purchase a jigsaw instead. Fence is not at all accurate, blades do not change as easily as stated, nothing on this unit is stays aligned for more than one cut, even when bolted down the unit shakes so much, the safety key falls out. Not at all satisfied. I wouldn't give this unit away, I believe it is not safe. I will accept the loss of $$ and junk it.
customer_reviews.author: K-Cuts

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw is great, makes my projects a lot easier. there is an adjustable guide on one side with a ruler for more precise measurements and to keep the wood straight.also a sliding handle to help push the wood along with adjustable angles for mitre cuts. The saw is easy to put together and requires no tools. the power switch is conveniently placed and easy to operate.There is also a hole for an optional vacuum attachment which is nice. if I had to make any changes it would be for the table top to be adjustable in size to accommodate larger pieces of wood.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Tabor

customer_reviews.title: Should work fine with my numerous projects
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly and with all the accessories. Put it together, though it was a bit hard to figure out with the lack of written instruction (pictures only tell you so much), but I easily cut through 1/8" birch wood. 1/2" will be the test, but I'll probably buy better quality jigsaws than what came with saw. So far I'm pleased and look forward to cutting all this wood I bought.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bak

customer_reviews.title: Its light weight and easy to carry around
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Its light weight and easy to carry around. Cons: It struggles and vibrate while cutting through a 10 mm laminated flooring The base moved around and lacks stability. Hard to cut straight, need to push hard for long straight cuts and the saw starts to vibrate. The blade vibrate so much after few use Does not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Might be the best tool for the value I ever purchased.
customer_reviews.text: I am retired and own a shop full of power tools. This has become my go to tool for cutting wood up to 1 inch thick. The fence and miter gauge provide for a lot of versatility. The blade holder keeps your work piece steady but can be removed for cuts on larger pieces. Think of this as an upside down jigsaw that allows you to cut curves, perfectly straight cuts with the fence or precise angles with the miter gauge. The only negatives are that it is loud (wear ear protection) and it goes through blades quickly.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Artley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Made my DIY project possible
customer_reviews.text: I am halfway through installing my new floors. I am a woman with no building experience. This little machine made it all possible! I only discovered that I need to buy more spare knives as they get dull fast. I recommend this machine for any DIY!
customer_reviews.author: Gia

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't worth the money. First it is too light and unstable, very hard to use; second, even when I have a good control and cut using the lined guides, the cut is still crooked and not straight.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Xiong

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Portable, and Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I build miniature scenery for train sets and table top wargames. Most of it is from MDF or thin plywood. This tool is versatile and works great for all of my applications where a table saw or circular saw would be too much. It allows for excellent details and speeds up my processes. Plus, its light and portable enough to take with me or move around if needed.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Very disapointed
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed is the saw is about 95% plastic. I decided I could live with its noise level. The plastic saw is very light and vibrates so bad it has to be mounted to a base to clam it down. The arm and blade guard are flimsily at best. The deal breaker was the blade is off center by a degree or two so you can’t get a straight cut even with the fence. Returning it today.
customer_reviews.author: DTP

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the fact I can take it with me however it doesn't work well at all. I tried cutting some very thin flimsy wood sheets with it but as soon as the wood reached the back piece of the guide it won't go anymore. Definitely a waste of my money. I can do better with my jig then this.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: For $100 this has been somewhat useful but definitely has it's shortcomings. I put up decorative wall planks and it cut that fine, although it's not especially precise. Struggled MIGHTILY cutting 3/4 inch plywood. It wasn't even the blade that struggled, the plywood just wouldn't feed through the back metal piece properly. Maybe a thicker blade that made a wider cut would allow the thicker pieces to feed better. Overall if I was to do it again I might spend a little more and get something else but this hasn't been totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: Snorman

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to install laminate flooring. Per product description and videos it should be able to rip the boards long ways. There is a cheap guide to help keep it straight, however, when the board gets to the part where the saw arm attaches to the base, it starts to jam the saw. Very disappointed in this. I should have gotten a table saw but this was said to be able to do the job. Would return it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Tater Salad

customer_reviews.title: Did the job done, though the accuracy of cuts is not high.
customer_reviews.text: Was indispensable for installing 10 mm thick engineered hardwood floor in a large basement. Where I struggled with was the stairs where the cutting accuracy of straight cuts had to be with better than 1/8" or even 1/16" across long cuts of several foot long. It's very difficult and time/ material consuming, though doable, with this saw design as the blade wobbles left-right quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Petrov

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the storage space challenged.
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for; a compact powerful saw that can be used anywhere It comes with almost everything I need and I love it. I have limited storage space so this is great! I also purchased the Crosscut Sled, which in my opinion should be included with the Saw.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M

customer_reviews.title: Bad piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: This is only the second review I have written as I don't usually take the time. However, in this case I think it very important to warn everyone just how bad this piece of equipment is. As a mechanical engineer by trade I can tell you the equipment is not made very well and isvery hard to cut straight with even when using either of the provide guides.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bosworth

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Great innovative design. It is basically a jigsaw mounted upside down. The ball bearing blade guide is very useful in keeping a straight cut. Tool is very light to carry around. All plastic shell - hopefully it will hold for few years. Come with 3 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: I didn't expect much for the price, but it's ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much for the price, but it's really a toy. Just a jig-saw mounted to a plastic box. If all you need is to make occasional short cuts in thin materials, well ok. Too big and loud for a modelling tool in a studio.Too small and light-duty for real work.
customer_reviews.author: Sean O'Skea

customer_reviews.title: Not like the advertisement videos! BUT, stil a viable option, to the home/ hobby, builder/installer/repairer.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small upstairs condo, with 6'x9' Lanai. This is not PRO Gear. But if you take your time and not force the issue, this is a cool helper around the house! Get a "workmate" style portable table/vice, to set this on, if you don't have a worktable. Clamps and a respectable set of different blades, are good also to make things easy.
customer_reviews.author: HawaiianEyeTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Rockwell BladeRunner X2 Portable Tabletop Saw with Steel Rip Fence RK7323
customer_reviews.text: The Rockwell BladeRunner X2 saw arrived undamaged & without incident. We really like this product. It has served us well. You can buy replacement blades at any of your local hardware stores. It is easy to use & there is no steep learning curve. It is a perfect saw for home DIYers.
customer_reviews.author: Moey

customer_reviews.title: Very useful to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: It is a very useful tool and allows you to do more precise cutting than a hand held jigsaw allows. The only drawback was the instructions. They could really use some improvement, but if you of a logical mind it will only take a bit to figure everything out.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, but more limited than advertised
customer_reviews.text: The saw is spec'd as being able to cut wood up to 11⁄2" thick. In reality, there's too much vibration and not enough power to cut anything more than 5⁄8" thick, even when using a better-quality blade than comes with the kit on softwood. So if you just want a saw for cutting plywood, tile, laminate flooring, or for jigsaw/scroll work on thin boards, you're fine. Anything thicker, and you'd be better off looking at a different tool.
customer_reviews.author: STH

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for the wife for her crafting projects, ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the wife for her crafting projects, she is intimidated by the table saw (it is a little overkill for what she was looking to accomplish). It's light enough for her to move around in her craft room, with quick blade changes can be used for a variety of materials, and a lot less intimidating than the table saw. I just might borrow it for doing quick projects here and there.
customer_reviews.author: Chance

customer_reviews.title: Poor accuracy. Blade bends while cutting
customer_reviews.text: If you require a good straight cut, this tool will not do it. I tried to cut squared pieces to make a box out of (1/8 or 1/4”) plexiglass. The results were frightening.
customer_reviews.author: Rocketman

customer_reviews.title: Sadly disappointed. Pretty much the price reflects the quality
customer_reviews.text: Sadly disappointed. Pretty much the price reflects the quality,, cheap crap. not good for most applications that you would normally use a scroll saw on. One speed only, fine cuts are impossible, and cuts into anything above 1 inch,,, hold on for dear life, because it will bounce the material out of your hand if it pinches even slightly.
customer_reviews.author: tra miller

customer_reviews.title: WOW Was I surprised. In a good way
customer_reviews.text: Had reservations at first , then I ordered it. WOW what a saw. This is very light ,as I am limited to lifting a limited amount of pounds, I can grab this saw with all the accessories very easy. The cuts are very good and I love the space that you have to work with. I used the Bosch blades. For the price the saw was much better than expected. It is a very good purchase as it works great and the mobility is great.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry E Irvin

customer_reviews.title: The quality itself seems good and although I have not put it through it's ...
customer_reviews.text: The instructions consist of deciphering pictures with NO text! The quality itself seems good and although I have not put it through it's paces, it seems to be the answer to my current situation of having a tiny shop and limited resources. Ideally I'd prefer a table saw, band saw and scroll saw, but at less than the cost of any one of those items this little bugger does all three tasks. I don't expect it to do any one of the tasks better or even as well as a tools dedicated to the specific task but I suspect this will get me through just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Geek

customer_reviews.title: A brand new unit died after 2hr of first use
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! The unit was used to rip trimming woods On and off for about 2 hrs. Then it had raddled noises, a few of small metal balls felt out, smokes, and died. This was the first use from a brand new unit (just unboxed after sitting on the shelf since it’s delivery in late March. Need to reach out to the manufacturer to see what they can do about this.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Hoang

customer_reviews.title: Really like this saw, very versatile
customer_reviews.text: I was truly impressed by this saw. I will say that although the blades that come with it are adequate, you will really appreciate the difference putting the Bosch blades is. When you get the hang of not letting the wood get pinched, you will see that it is very precise, especially if you use the Bosch blades. One thing other reviewers notice is that original blade will bend as to not cut straight, the Bosch blades don't seem to bend and stay very straight.
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Reviewr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Rockwell knocked it out of the park with this one! This thing is sweet. We have been remodeling our home and this has helped so much. The saw is very sturdy and really cuts nice. So far I have used it on wood, metal, and pvc. No complaints at all. Its quiet and cuts a nice even cut. This is the perfect DIY portable saw. Great deal on a great saw!
customer_reviews.author: Toby Wright

customer_reviews.title: Unit vibrates a lot.
customer_reviews.text: Very light. Easy to use. Make sure you anchor the unit to a bench or heavy table. It tends to vibrate a lot, and moves around. This is inconvenient when you are mobile, and have to move from the deck to the garage, to the house or to the basement.
customer_reviews.author: john6b1

customer_reviews.title: Great mini table saw!
customer_reviews.text: Great mini table saw! Works very well for mini woodworking projects. Rips 1/2" plywood very easily. Purchased wall mount bracket and sled. Love that it uses jig saw blades. All and all, this was a great set of purchases. I do recommend these items for any hobby woodworking enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Reyna

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: When you read the reviews saying this saw is incapable of making a straight - or complete - cut because the blade guides are insufficient believe them. I tried this on a 5/4 x 6 deck board and it failed and was boxed and returned within a couple of hours of delivery. Look elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Retro3600

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for installing laminate flooring. It does cross cuts and rip cuts with ease. It's compact so easy to store in between projects. The blade assortment included is better than expected. There is no size restrictions on the length of cut, either. I can't speak to how it would fare for heavy duty use, but for this project it was exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Damon L.

customer_reviews.title: Delicate but works
customer_reviews.text: It fits my needs, but the blade is so wobbly I’m constantly afraid I’ll break it. It is secured/attached properly. Also, the vacuum tube does not catch very much saw dust. I had it directly attached to a medium sized shop vac with a correctly sized hose.
customer_reviews.author: D. Casey

customer_reviews.title: Nice alternative to a large table saws
customer_reviews.text: Really like this little guy. You can cut fairly wide rips. It is the perfect saw for trim work. Setup is a snap use is easy. One note is that you need to set the rip fence accurately to ensure the work piece slides smoothly past the arm support. This is not particularly heavy duty, but is great for those small jobs around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Chim Chim

customer_reviews.title: you could receive a saw with chartreuse parts
customer_reviews.text: All pictures show an all black saw which is what I wanted. I received one that has a CHARTREUSE miter gauge and guard arm clamp. This is probably an older color scheme that was very unpopular but is still being sold. Lowes picture has this color setup which is why I chose this one. If I were to send it back, it could be replaced with the same thing and is not worth the effort. So beware.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Great item! Made things really easy to get done
customer_reviews.text: Great item! Made things really easy to get done. Cut great...only suggestion would be to make the four rubberized legs suction cups. I don't have a long term work bench that I can screw it down too. On larger sheets of thin wood it would vibrate a lot. However...this is a great little saw and I'm a military wife that needs something like this for small projects. LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: cjmbwilson

customer_reviews.title: Love my Rockwell saw
customer_reviews.text: Love this little saw. I’m a DYIer and this tool comes in so handy for small work that I use it for. It’s great at a notch cut. I haven’t used all the blades yet but it did work for some wood pieces. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: used it for cutting metal and it saved me a lot of work.
customer_reviews.text: its great having this item, used it for cutting metal, it saved me a lot of work... however its not the best tool for cutting true right angles in wood and the alignment of the fence is a ongoing project (i am not the best DIY person around, so it could be all me) ~ yikes~
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for light weight cutting
customer_reviews.text: This unit is great for lightweight cutting, not too good if not permanently mounted to give it some stability- there is too much vibration to keep it a portable unit. I don't recommend doing anything thicker than 1.5 inches. For small wood crafting it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Betty F

customer_reviews.title: Use stabilizer bolts, or a couple of screwdrivers will work too.
customer_reviews.text: I had a little trouble lining up the anti-vibration guide wheels above the blade. I don't have that problem licked quite yet but overall, it works great for light duty use. I'm pretty happy with what it can do.
customer_reviews.author: J, Vermont

customer_reviews.title: Good little light saw.
customer_reviews.text: For light jobs like cutting half-round molding it's a good little saw. I use it around the house and for cutting thin woods for craft projects. The only negative on this is that it vibrates a bit more while cutting than I'd like. You have to take that into consideration when using it, be ready and steady. Well worth the money and I'm pleased with it. It's not light as a feather but it's light enough for me to carry up and down the stairs when I need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: usra_mikado

customer_reviews.title: Does 85% of what you’d use a jig saw for and it is much easier to handle.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I like being able to maneuver the board while I cut. It doesn’t replace the need for jig saw, but it’ll do 85%. Not able to cut a cycle in a long board due to the fact it is a table design and the arm will inhibit the circular motion
customer_reviews.author: Sharly

customer_reviews.title: I will say installing the blade was tricky. Push in red button and PUSH LEFT then you will see blade hole rotate to center
customer_reviews.text: what a great little machine. I am cutting metal 3/4 round and square pipes and gauge works amazing, The blade guide works great. excellent blades provided.. I will say installing the blade was tricky. Push in redbutton and PUSH LEFT then you will see blade hole rotate to center for install..
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Anderson
